name: ishlo
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, chlo), wa(wcel(c0, ccbn), wcel(c0, ccphlo)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, chlo), wa(wcel(c0, ccbn), wcel(c0, ccphlo)))
-| wceq(chlo, cin(ccbn, ccphlo))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CHilOLD ↔(c0 ∈ CBan ∧ c0 ∈ CPreHilOLD))
⊣ CHilOLD =(CBan ⋂ CPreHilOLD)

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, chlo), wa(wcel(c0, ccbn), wcel(c0, ccphlo)))
-| wceq(chlo, cin(ccbn, ccphlo))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CHilOLD ↔(c0 ∈ CBan ∧ c0 ∈ CPreHilOLD))
⊣ CHilOLD =(CBan ⋂ CPreHilOLD)

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wcel(c0, chlo), wa(wcel(c0, ccbn), wcel(c0, ccphlo)))

comment: The predicate "is a complex Hilbert space." A Hilbert space is a Banach space which is also an inner product space, i.e. whose norm satisfies the parallelogram law. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 28-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
